data.event: Francisco Cortés de San Buenaventura arrived followed in 1530 by Nuño de Guzman, and Juan de Escárcena.
In 1542 San Marcos was visited by the Viceroy D. Antonio de Mendoza on his way to put down a large indigenous rebellion.
The town itself was founded in Jun 28, 1740, by Fray Antonio de Jesus who was instrumental in construction of the church.

event.title: was officially founded by decree on April 17, 1907

data.event: The city was officially founded by decree on April 17, 1907, which became effective the following April.

event.title: the early 1900s, during the rule of Mexican dictator Porfirio Diaz, the Mexican government forcibly marched

data.event: In the early 1900s, during the rule of Mexican dictator Porfirio Diaz, the Mexican government forcibly marched thousands of Yaquis some 200 miles over the mountains from San Blas to San Marcos and its train station.

event.title: 1908, at least five thousand Yaqui had been sold

data.event: By 1908, at least five thousand Yaqui had been sold into forced slavery.
